botanical_details.genus: Chrysanthemum are erect woody-based perennials with aromatic, pinnately lobed leaves and flowerheads of diverse form, from late summer to late autumn
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Single Korean chrysanthemums are perennials with lobed leaves and single flowerheads

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in a cold frame in a loam-based potting compost and move into a warm glasshouse in early autumn. Provide bright filtered light with good ventilation and a minimum temperature of 10 °C. During the growing season water moderately and apply a balanced liquid fertiliser weekly. See chrysanthemum cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by rooting softwood cuttings in loam-less potting compost at 16 °C in spring
how_to_grow.pruning: Pinch out growing tips and disbud as required
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to leaf and bud eelworm, aphids, glasshouse whitefly, glasshouse red spider mite and capsid bug
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to glasshouse grey moulds, powdery mildews and chrysanthemum white rust
